intro: Oionychion pedatum, commonly known as the common sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically features small, green, succulent leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas or dry, open habitats. Oionychion pedatum is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient and hardy species.
